page.title: 02Land usage in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: Bwlchysarnau is an upland area of poor wet acidic soil.Much drainage and reseeding has altered the character of some of the fields, many of which were permanent pasture containing native species of plants found in old hay meadows and bogs. There are not many deciduous trees in the area,mainly due to the height (above 320m), the windswept terrain and acid soil conditions. Extensive sites were bought by the Forestry Commission in 1930-40 and planted with coniferous trees.Much of this is now reaching maturity and provides some jobs;trimming and cleaning the trees, some of which go for pulping and others for stakes,posts and planking. These areas are often used for car rallies and motorcycle trials due to the network of forestry tracks and roads.
